respStmt.resp: Text retrieval, preprocessing, automatic linguistic annotation, TEI conversion and curation
respStmt.name: Helena Bermúdez Sabel

respStmt.resp: Semantic annotation and correction of the automatic annotation of modal passages
respStmt.name: Francesca Dell’Oro

publicationStmt.distributor: Institut des sciences du langage (University of Neuchâtel)

sourceDesc.p: Text provided by Epigraphic Database Rome (EDR). Record: EDR169402, 24-04-2021 (Annarosa GALLO) . Based on the edition: Gallo, Annarosa, “Senatus consulta de Bacchanalibus. Normenpluralität in der Tafel von Tiriolo und in der livianischen Überlieferung” in Die senatus consulta in den epigraphischen Quellen. Texte und Bezeugungen edited by Pierangelo Buongiorno and Giuseppe Camodeca. Stuttgart: Franz Steiner Verlag. 2021, pp. 107-145.

projectDesc.p: The SNSF-funded project A world of possibilities. Modal pathways over an extra-long period of time: the diachrony of modality in the Latin language (WoPoss) (SNSF n° PP00P1_176778), led by Francesca Dell’Oro, aims at reconstructing the evolution of modal meanings from the prehistory of the Latin language up to the 7th century CE.

encodingDesc.p: The project’s repository annotation-schemes contains documentation about the annotation process and all our customized schemas (formalised in ODD and Relax-NG).

f.name: note
f.string: + control as interpreted as "to have got hold of something"

f.name: note
f.string: The subjunctive of volo is used to express an order.

f.name: note
f.string: NB. it works like a kind of imperative

f.name: note
f.string: The participant of the scope is not determined
